talks.title: The three levels of understanding
talks.abstract:
In the last couple of years, I have been a reader, a student, an apprentice, a researcher, a speaker, a trainer, and above all a passionate debater. These activities have something in common: they are all in some way about teaching and learning. Like most people, I did not need a lot of time in school to believe that there are good teachers and bad teachers. But it took me years to understand that it is actually all about good and bad ways to understand things. This talk is a lot about learning, and a bit about teaching if you see it as the action allowing others to learn efficiently.

Starting from a simple exemple, we will go through the 3 levels of understanding together : syntactic, semantic, inductive. We will discuss the symptoms of misunderstanding at each of these levels, and what it means to miss a step on this journey to the third level of understanding.

I will also present a few exemples of these 3 levels in the real world, and conclude on how all of this can help us be better trainers, better speakers and better consultants.
talks.comments: Either french or english, depending on the audience.

talks.title: Introduction to Deep Reinforcement Learning
talks.abstract:
Following Big Data revolution, advent of Machine Learning is now a reality.  By giving computers the ability to learn from data, in order to turn these data into knowledge, the importance of Machine Learning in Computer Science is continuously increasing.

The most famous, and used, paradigms of Machine Learning are Supervised and Unsupervised Learning. In this talk, we will discuss a third paradigm which is quite exciting although it is not well-known: Reinforcement Learning.  

Contrary to Supervised and Unsupervised Learning which aims at making single predictions one after the other, Reinforcement Learning is much more ambitious (and thus complicated...): it aims at building an exhaustive strategy by learning successive series of actions in a dynamic environment, in order to optimize an overall reward.

After a short presentation of theoretical foundations, we will introduce the terminology and present the main algorithms. We will particularly focus on Reinforcement Learning algorithms involving Deep Neural Networks, which have been a major breakthrough in the field. Some applications will be presented.

Ever thought that [Python](https://www.python.org/)üêç belongs to the *dark side of IT*? That its birth as a scripting language makes it relevant only for ‚Äú*magisticians*‚Äú who run data-science services that do not comply with industry standards? Our guest Lucius Malforel will introduce you to:
- [pyenv](https://github.com/pyenv/pyenv/) (üêß, üçè, [üî≤](https://github.com/pyenv-win/pyenv-win)) lets you choose the Python language version, at the project level (much finer than with java-alternatives or nvm)
- built over pip and virtual environment, [poetry](https://python-poetry.org/docs/) manages your prod & dev dependencies (with a lock-file for the transitive dependencies - convenient when building üê≥ images) but also eases the publication of your libraries on [PyPI](https://pypi.org/) (the Python Package Index, a depository like maven or nvm)

- start playing with data in a [Jupyter notebook](https://jupyter.org/) with a simple docker-compose file: *magistics* (magic + statistics) is now at the tip of your wand ‚ú®!

talks.title: "Where Are We Going, Captain?"
talks.abstract:
Switching product roadmap direction on the fly, extra dev hours & week-ends trashed, hard work that will never reach Prod and will never be shipped on users hands...

The bad news is that unfortunately this is the daily struggle of dev or product team. 
The reason why is it happening? Almost all the time this comes from a lack of Product Vision, that North start that will set the course.

The **good news is that you can change it**!
Tech people, don't wait for business owners to have proper Product Vision! On this workshop you will learn 3 easy to apply techniques that you can push and own as a dev team in order to set the direction get the stakeholders buy-in!

So roll up your sleeves, STOP undergoing. Get your virtual post'its,  your oratory skills and get ready to have fun ü¶Ñ

Alors essayons de fonctionner par th√©matique voulez-vous ?

## Je suis un vieux gamer
J‚Äôai eu cette chance de grandir il y a fort longtemps avec un Amstrad CPC 6128 sur lequel j‚Äôai pass√© mes longues soir√©es d‚Äôhiver (et d‚Äô√©t√©) √† me cramer les r√©tines devant des jeux dont les graphismes √©taient ‚Ä¶ basiques (?)

En parlant de Basic tiens, ce fut mon premier langage de programmation, l‚Äôoccasion pour moi de faire mes armes et un plaisir qui ne me quittera jamais.

Aujourd‚Äôhui encore je prends beaucoup de plaisir sur les jeux vid√©o, le plus souvent sur des jeux indies, loin des triples A.

## Je suis un vieux d√©veloppeur
Basic d‚Äôabord. HTML, CSS et JS ensuite. Java pendant 15 ans‚Ä¶ Php pendant 8 ans, Python, Re-JS, NodeJS, Kotlin, etc. Je ne compte plus le nombre de langages test√©s ou masteris√©s √† leur √©poque.

C‚Äôest toujours avec plaisir, apr√®s toutes ces ann√©es, que je retourne au chantier, la plong√©e dans la documentation, les premiers succ√®s, les nuits d‚Äôinsomnies, autant de plaisir un peu masochiste.

## Je suis un formateur
Le plaisir d‚Äôapprendre passe chez moi par le plaisir de partager mes connaissances pour peu que l‚Äôon me le demande. Que ce soit sur des sujets techniques (git), de sujets de management et de gestion de projet (agilit√©, scrum, sm, kanban, po, etc.) ou sur des sujets qui n‚Äôont rien √† voir avec mon m√©tier (formateur croix rouge), je tente de partager ma passion et de remercier la communaut√© pour tout ce qu‚Äôelle a pu m‚Äôapporter toutes ses ann√©es d‚Äôapprentissage.

## Je suis un agiliste convaincu
Mais pas un fachiste de la m√©thode.

Vous ne me verrez pas jurer QUE par l‚Äôagilit√©. Mon passif de chef de projet forfait m‚Äôen emp√™che. Et puis √† creuser un peu des sujets tels que les matrices de complexit√© on se rend compte vite de la place que peut occuper les m√©thodes agiles dans le monde des projets aujourd‚Äôhui‚Ä¶ et les endroits o√π elle n‚Äôa pas sa place.

Tout comme les formations, je tiens √† remercier la communaut√© en participant √† mon simple niveau en tant qu‚Äôorganisateur de l‚Äôagile tour Rennes depuis quelques ann√©es maintenant.

Aider les √©quipes √† grandir dans leur pratique de la gestion de projet est actuellement ma principale occupation, un nouveau challenge pour 2021.

## Je touche √† beaucoup de choses
G√©n√©alogiste, plongeur, secouriste, podcaster, jardinier, contributeur du monde open source, voyageur et papa accessoirement, autant d‚Äôaventures et autant de possibilit√©s d‚Äôapprendre des autres.
